wikipedia_page.main: Colin Forsyth (c. 1947 – 31 May 2018) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s. He played at representative level for England, and at club level for Heworth A.R.L.F.C., Oldham (Heritage № 676), Featherstone Rovers (Heritage № 465), Bradford Northern and Wakefield Trinity (Heritage № 876), as a prop, i.e. number 8 or 10, during the era of contested scrums. Colin Forsyth broke his arm in the 1974–75 season.

response: * Colin Forsyth won caps for England while at Bradford Northern in 1975 against France, New Zealand, Wales
* Colin Forsyth, English professional rugby league footballer
